node.title: Two more COVID-related deaths confirmed in Queensland, 11,174 new cases
node.alt: Chief Health Officer John Gerrard speaking into a row of microphones.
node.description: Chief Health Officer John Gerrard says a man in his 30s died "unexpectedly" at his home on January 5, and confirmed the death of a man on the Gold Coast was also COVID-related.
node.content:
["A man in his 30s\u00a0died \"unexpectedly\" at home on January 5 after contracting COVID-19, Queensland's Chief Health Officer John Gerrard confirms.", "\"The coroner has reported to us that the cause of his death was related to COVID-19. I can also confirm he was unvaccinated,\" Dr Gerrard said.\u00a0", "He said\u00a0the death of another man on the Gold Coast had also been attributed to COVID-19.", "Queensland confirmed 11,174 new COVID-19 cases in the latest reporting period.", "Dr Gerrard said the deaths of young people from COVID-19 were \"rare and particularly unexpected\".", "\"The most common cause of the sudden deaths in young people relate to infection\u00a0by the virus of the heart, myocarditis, and that's the probable cause in both of these individuals.\"", "Health Minister Yvette D'Ath announced a statewide suspension of non-urgent elective surgery in Queensland public hospitals.", "\"That is category three and some category two surgery,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"Many of the hospital and health services have already initiated this at a local level over the past few days, but now we are initiating this as a statewide initiative for our public hospitals.\"", "Ms D'Ath said there were 349 COVID-positive people in Queensland hospitals, with 17 in intensive care and three on ventilators.", "Dr Gerrard said the caseload in hospitals was \"creeping up\".", "\"Our biggest issue in hospitals at the moment is the number of staff that are having either to quarantine because they are contacts or in isolation because they have the virus themselves,\" he said.", "\"Most often, staff are not catching the virus from patients they're catching it in the community like the rest of us.\"", "More to come.", "", "
What to do if you're unwell and suspect you have COVID but can't get a test.
"]
